snomed_indications.reasoning: Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GORD) in adults.
Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease, including duodenal and gastric ulcers.
Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, a condition characterized by excessive gastric acid secretion.
Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of gastrointestinal motility disorders, including irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of dyspepsia, a condition characterized by upper abdominal discomfort.

Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of gastrointestinal bleeding, including variceal bleeding and peptic ulcer bleeding.

Note: The SNOMED codes and terms used in this example are fictional and for demonstration purposes only. Actual SNOMED CT codes and terms should be used in a real-world analysis.
